course_detail.other_information:
Recommended the first course in machine learning. Prerequisites are strict. This course counts as a methods course for COS AB juniors and is connected to a parallel Junior Research Workshop in machine learning.  **AB'24 COS students will be enrolled in COS 981 separately and will complete the AB'24 Junior Research Workshop form.**
Waitlist can be found here - https://forms.gle/JTCnA4fNa9muj1GFA
course_detail.subject: COS
course_detail.other_restrictions: MAT 104, MAT 202/204/217 or EGR 154 and COS 226.
course_detail.reading_writing_assignment: Problem sets and programming exercises. Programming assignments will use python.
course_detail.description: Provides a broad introduction to different machine learning paradigms and algorithms, providing a foundation for further study or independent work in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data science. Topics include linear models for classification and regression, support vector machines, neural networks, clustering, principal components analysis, Markov decision processed, planning, and reinforcement learning.
